reference.title: Adding new targets to the Ant build process
reference.shortdesc: The Ant conductor extension point is used to make new targets available to the Ant processing pipeline. This may be done as part of creating a new transform, extending pre-processing, or simply to provide Ant targets for the use of other plug-ins.

dd.p: Add Ant import to main Ant build file.
dd.note: The dita.conductor.target extension is deprecated. Use dita.conductor.target.relative instead.

example.title: Example
example.p: To extend And processing, first place your extensions in an Ant project file within your plug-in, such as myAntStuff.xml. Next, create a small wrapper file myAntStuffWrapper.xml in the same directory:
When the plug-in is integrated, the imports from myAntStuffWrapper.xml will be copied into build.xml (using the correct path). This makes targets in myAntStuff.xml available to any other processing.
